Package com.documentum.fc.client.search

Interface IDfSearchSource

public interface IDfSearchSource
Represents a source for executing a query. Query supports multiple sources of different types. Currently only types of SRC_TYPE_DOCBASE and SRC_TYPE_EXTERNAL are supported.
See Also:
  • IDfQueryDefinition

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final String
    CAP_ALL_VERSIONS
    Supports search for all versions of objects.
    static final String
    CAP_DEFAULT_LOGIN
    The adapter to the source is setup with a default account (user login optional).
    static final String
    CAP_DUPLICATE_REMOVAL
    Supports automatic duplicate removal.
    static final String
    CAP_FTDQL
    Supports FTDQL semantics.
    static final String
    CAP_HIDDEN_OBJ
    Supports searching hidden objects.
    static final String
    CAP_LOGICAL_OR_EXPR_SET
    Supports logical OR operation between expressions of a set.
    static final String
    CAP_LOGIN
    Supports login.
    static final String
    CAP_TRY_FTDQL_FIRST
    Supports TRY_FTDQL_FIRST Hint.
    static final String
    CAP_USER_LOGIN
    The user can provide credentials to authenticate to the source.
    static final int
    SRC_TYPE_DEFAULT
    Internal default source type (repository).
    static final int
    SRC_TYPE_DOCBASE
    Source type of a Documentum repository.
    static final int
    SRC_TYPE_EXTERNAL
    External (non-repository) source type.
    static final int
    SRC_TYPE_UNDEFINED
    Internal source type used to identify uninitialized instance.

      • Constant Field Values

    • CAP_USER_LOGIN

      static final String CAP_USER_LOGIN
      The user can provide credentials to authenticate to the source. If the source does not have this capability, then it should have the #CAP_CORPORATE_LOGIN capability. This capability can be cumulated with #CAP_CORPORATE_LOGIN. In this case, the user can either choose to provide credential or relies on the default one.
      See Also:
      • CAP_DEFAULT_LOGIN
      • Constant Field Values

    • CAP_DEFAULT_LOGIN

      static final String CAP_DEFAULT_LOGIN
      The adapter to the source is setup with a default account (user login optional).
      See Also:
      • CAP_USER_LOGIN
      • Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • getType

      int getType()
      Gets the Search Source type of the current instance. Can be one of the folloing:
      • SRC_TYPE_DOCBASE
      • SRC_TYPE_EXTERNAL
      Returns:
      The search source type.

    • getName

      String getName()
      Gets the name of the source.
      Returns:
      The name of the source.

    • getDescription

      String getDescription()
      Gets the (optional) source description.
      Returns:
      The source description; empty string if no description is provided.

    • getHomeURL

      URL getHomeURL()
      Gets the home URL of this search source.
      Returns:
      The home URL; or null if none (like for repositories).

    • hasCapability

      boolean hasCapability(String capability)
      Gets the specified source capability.
      Parameters:
      capability - can be one of the following:
      • CAP_ALL_VERSIONS
      • CAP_DUPLICATE_REMOVAL
      • CAP_FTDQL
      • CAP_HIDDEN_OBJ
      • CAP_LOGICAL_OR_EXPR_SET
      • CAP_LOGIN
      • CAP_TRY_FTDQL_FIRST
      Returns:
      true, if specified capability is supported.

    • isFacetSupported

      boolean isFacetSupported(IDfSessionManager sessionManager)
      Indicates if the source supports facets. One can use the facets methods available in IDfQueryBuilder and IDfQueryProcessor
      See Also:
      • IDfQueryBuilder.addFacetDefinition(DfFacetDefinition)
      • IDfQueryProcessor.getFacets()

    • isRangeAccessSupported

      boolean isRangeAccessSupported(IDfSessionManager sessionManager)
      Indicates if the source supports range access.

    • areMetadataWildcardsSupported

      boolean areMetadataWildcardsSupported(IDfSessionManager sessionManager)
      Indicates if wildcards in metadata searches can be used with this source.
